We petition that parliament must refer all proposals for sanctions, aggression, regime change, political interference in a foreign country to a referendum. In all cases all proposals be supported by the UN.
In the case of Iraq the entire electorate was misled and without  any accountability the electorate was left with the bill by way of austerity measures imposed. Double standards were adopted.
There is a serious need to prevent reoccurrence of Iraq and give assurance that restrictions have been put in place for the safety of the electorate so that they will not be once again left with the bill for negligence, We  simply cannot afford it.
Sadly we have moved from the policy of promoting peace and British Trade to the US policy of aggression and regime change, reducing trade and tarnishing Britain’s international repute.
Austerity will not succeed without Parliamentary reform. .
